brief_description: Immunoprofiling of acute and convalescent blood samples from CHIKV infected children
brief_title: Chikungunya virus infection immunoprofiling in pediatric cohort
description: Serum/plasma, PAXgene and PBMC were collected from CHIKV-infected patients at acute (day 1-2 post symptom onset) and convalescent (day 15-17 post symptom onset) time points. RNA-seq (PAXgene samples), Luminex (serum/plasma samples) and CyTOF (PBMCs) was used to analyse the immune profile of CHIKV infection in a pediatric cohort from Nicaragua
endpoints: Compare the immune profile of acute versus convalescent samples
hypothesis: Acute CHIKV infection leads to the activation and upregulation of several biomarkers that are important for the innate immune response
objectives: Identify biomarkers of acute CHIKV infection and correlate these with severity of disease
official_title: Comprehensive innate immune profiling of chikungunya virus infection in pediatric cases

arm.description: CHIKV symptoms confirmed by Q-RT PCR
arm.name: CHIKV patient

pubmed.title: Comprehensive innate immune profiling of chikungunya virus infection in pediatric cases.
